parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To be with, come together with. From sun and eimi; to be in company with, i.e. Present at the time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To interrogate, question, demand of. From epi and erotao; to ask for, i.e. Inquire, seek.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
